channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dumped household renovations waste, 14th November
item.description:
Yet again people are dumping household renovations waste outside the penge east dry cleaners. It is becoming their favourite dumping spot and it's unsightly for those of us who live nearby and have to pass by every day. This waste has been there about 3 days

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Newlands Park, Penge, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Pathway flooded and unpassable, 14th November
item.description:
Please can shingle be laid on the main pathway so that we can all use the park during this terrible weather. There are some very large ruts which have been created by IdVerde driving in and out of the park and they do need to drive in and out. But the road/pathway needs to be better. Hence the request for shingle to fill the holes. Can the road also be flattened to help get rid of the ruts. This would greatly help the blind and partially sighted people who visit the park, along with those less abled or those with prams. Many thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Chase, Widmore, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken street lamp not replaced, 14th November
item.description:
The street lamp outside 20 Lincoln Road was removed over a month ago because it was hanging by one wire, however it has not been replaced and the street is extremely dark presenting a trip and fall hazard. People are having to use their phone lights to get through that bit of road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lincoln Road, North End, Erith, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet
